thread.title: Hat's off to Lastra: Acorn nets nine goals in 16-12 win over Independence
thread.title_full: Hat's off to Lastra: Acorn nets nine goals in 16-12 win over Independence

author: cbarrera@svnewspapers.com(Cheeto Barrera)
title: Hat's off to Lastra: Acorn nets nine goals in 16-12 win over Independence
text:
by Cheeto Barrera 
Live Oak coach Ronnie Gautschi wasn’t happy after a 16-12 win over Independence. 
The game was too close for comfort and she said it might have been because she focused more on the match to come than the game against the 76ers. 
“Independence came out and played to win. We looked past that in the first half,” Gautschi said. “They knew I was serious after half.” 
But when Gautschi needed a spark, she turned to her best scorer and Claudia Lastra didn’t disappoint her coach. Gautschi said she doesn’t lack confidence in her player, it was just a matter of getting her player to buy into that. 
“It’s confidence for her,” Gautschi said. “I believe that you can do it, now it’s time for you to believe you can do it.” 
Lastra had a hat trick of hat tricks. 
That’s right, three hat tricks in one game: nine goals. On top of that, she had a hat trick in the first half. One in the second. A natural hat trick in the second quarter alone. It was a stat geek’s dream game. 
And Live Oak needed every one of her goals. 
Independence wouldn’t go away quietly, despite the Acorns jumping out to a sizable lead after three quarters. 
The Acorns also got big help from Jennifer Poonia in goal. 
She made 10 saves, including a few at point blank range in the fourth quarter to keep Independence off the board. 
“She’s taken that job very seriously. I’m proud of the day she had,” Gautschi said. 
Poonia has never played goalie before and got in there because Gautschi said the girl had long arms and has acquitted herself nicely in the cage. 
The 76ers actually led after the first quarter, thanks to a trio of goals in the later minutes of the frame. 
Live Oak had gone up early on a goal from Olivia Freitas, who finished with three for the game. 
After the 76ers answered, Lastra scored the first of her nine goals to retake the lead, 2-1. 
In the second quarter, Lastra shined. 
After Taylor Bohn made the game 4-3, Lastra scored four consecutive goals to give Live Oak the lead for good. 
The two teams went into the break with the Acorns leading 7-5. 
During the break, Gautschi challenged her team to step it up. And they answered. 
Lastra had three goals. Freitas had two goals, Lecia Stover had a goal and Madison Blazzard had a goal. 
“I think Maddy played pretty well,” Gautschi said. “…She played better today than I’ve seen her play. Playing whole D is another job and it’s not fun.” 
Live Oak finished the whirlwind frame leading 14-8 over the 76ers. 
“They had to do it then if ever,” Gautschi said. 
But the work wasn’t quite done. Independence scored four times in the fourth quarter to make the game closer, but the Acorns hung on.
